action.action-desc: Ms. Sherrill (for herself and Mrs. Hayes) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives for the establishment and operation of small food retail businesses in areas with high food retail concentration and low levels of competition.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring Establishment Deductions and Uplifting Competition to Ease Food Prices Act or the REDUCE Food Prices Act.

section.header: Increased rehabilitation tax credit for qualified small food retail businesses

subsection.text: Section 47 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Special rule for qualified small food retail businesses

paragraph.text: In the case of a qualified rehabilitated building placed in service by a qualified small food retail business, subsection (a)(2) shall be applied by substituting 25 percent for 20 percent.

paragraph.header: Qualified small food retail business defined

subparagraph.text: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term qualified small food retail business means a business—

clause.text: which is described in section 38(c)(5) (determined by applying $200,000,000 for $50,000,000 in such section),
at least 70 percent of the annual average gross receipts of which are attributable to the retail sale of food or produce, and
which is located in a low-competition area.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term low-competition area means a county with respect to which the Herfindahl-Hirschman Index for the retail food sector, as measured by the Economic Research Service of the United States Department of Agriculture, is at or above a level of 1,400.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increased work opportunity tax credit for qualified small food retail businesses

subsection.text: Section 51(b)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.header: Increased limitation for qualified small food retail businesses

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increased bonus depreciation for qualified small food retail businesses

subsection.text: Section 168(k) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Special rule for qualified small food retail businesses

subparagraph.header: Increased applicable percentage for property placed in service by qualified small food retail businesses
subparagraph.text: In the case of property placed in service by a taxpayer that is a qualified small food retail business (as defined in section 47(e)(2)(A)), paragraph (6) shall be applied—

subclause.text: by substituting 70 percent for 60 percent each place it appears,
by substituting 50 percent for 40 percent each place it appears, and
by substituting 30 percent for 20 percent each place it appears, and
by substituting 70 percent for 60 percent each place it appears,
by substituting 50 percent for 40 percent each place it appears, and
by substituting 30 percent for 20 percent each place it appears.

subparagraph.header: Increased applicable percentage for plants bearing fruits and nuts planted or grafted by qualified small food retail businesses
subparagraph.text: In the case of plants bearing fruits and nuts planted or grafted by a taxpayer that is a qualified small food retail business (as defined in section 47(e)(2)(A)), paragraph (6)(C) shall be applied—

clause.text: by substituting 70 percent for 60 percent each place it appears,
by substituting 50 percent for 40 percent each place it appears, and
by substituting 30 percent for 20 percent each place it appears.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service, or plants planted or grafted, after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Increased qualified business income deduction for qualified small food retail businesses

subsection.text: Section 199A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating subsection (i) as subsection (j) and by inserting after subsection (h) the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Special rule for qualified small food retail businesses
subsection.text: In the case of a qualified small food retail business (as defined in section 47(e)(2)(A)), subsection (a)(2) shall be applied by substituting 25 percent for 20 percent.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: New food retail business tax credit

subsection.text: Subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

For purposes of section 38, in the case of a new small food retail business, the new food retail business credit under this section for the taxable year is an amount equal to 15 percent of qualified investment amounts paid or incurred during the taxable year.

paragraph.text: The term new food retail business means a qualified small food retail business (as defined in section 47(e)(2)(A)) which began operations during the previous three taxable years.
The term qualified investment amounts means amounts paid for capital investment in the property, facilities, or equipment of a business premises used for retail sales of the new food retail business.

subsection.header: Credit part of general business credit
subsection.text: Section 38(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking plus at the end of paragraph (40), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (41) and inserting , plus, and by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the new food retail business credit determined under section 45BB(a).

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 45BB. New food retail business credit.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
